hub.subtitle: Dense PDFs and buried spreadsheets turned into interactive visual stories.
hub.tagline: Real data. No spin. Open source.
hub.budgetDescription: Where Rs 50 lakh crore goes. Revenue sources, ministry-wise spending, state transfers, and your personal tax share.

hero.perCapita: That's Rs {{amount}} per citizen per day

narratives.revenueIntro: The government raises revenue from taxes, borrowings, and non-tax sources. Let's see where each rupee comes from.
narratives.deficitIntro: But revenue alone doesn't cover the bill. The government borrows to bridge the gap.
narratives.expenditureIntro: Now let's trace where this money goes. Every ministry, every scheme, every crore.
narratives.flowIntro: Follow the flow from your pocket through the Central Government to the spending that shapes the country.
narratives.mapIntro: Nearly one in four rupees flows directly to states and union territories. Here's where it lands.
narratives.perCapitaIntro: What does all this mean for a single citizen? Here's what the government spends on you every day.

revenue.heading: Where the money comes from
revenue.borrowingAnnotation: Each square = 1%. For every rupee earned, the government borrows {{paise}} paise more.

deficit.annotation: The fiscal deficit stands at {{percent}}% of GDP. For every rupee the government spends, it earns {{earned}} paise from taxes and other revenue. The rest is debt.
deficit.source: Source: Union Budget 2025-26, Budget at a Glance

expenditure.heading: Where the money goes
expenditure.annotation: Nearly half of every rupee goes to state transfers and interest payments. The rest funds defence, infrastructure, welfare, and more.

flow.heading: Follow the money
flow.annotation: Revenue sources flow through the Central Government to spending heads. Wider bands mean larger amounts.
flow.source: Source: Union Budget 2025-26, Budget at a Glance

map.heading: {{amount}} to states
map.annotation: Nearly 1 in 4 rupees of central spending flows directly to state governments. Colour intensity shows per-capita transfer — what each citizen's share looks like.

perCapita.annotation: The government spends Rs {{annual}} per citizen per year. Here's how a single day breaks down across the top spending areas.
perCapita.source: Source: Union Budget 2025-26, Expenditure Budget. Population estimate: 145 crore.

calculator.title: Find Your Share
calculator.description: Enter your income. See exactly where your tax rupees go across Defence, Education, Health, and every ministry.

explorer.title: Data Explorer
explorer.description: Full dataset. Sortable tables, scheme-level breakdowns, per-capita numbers. Export to CSV.
